comment: Hi I'd like to get refund of the Double-the-fun Perk that I have purchased. Can you withdraw the transaction? because I'm planning to get a retail perk with several people and might be changing the payment method. Thank you for your kindness and keep go on!
comment_html: Hi I’d like to get refund of the Double-the-fun Perk that I have purchased. Can you withdraw the transaction? because I’m planning to get a retail perk with several people and might be changing the payment method. Thank you for your kindness and keep go on!

replies.reply_text:
Hi Du Young, you can always upgrade you perk, you don't need to cancel your order just upgrade it, I hope this helped you.
Thank you for the support.

comment: You still have not answered my question as to whether consumers of the product will be able to fly with the O2 canisters on a commercial airline?
comment_html: You still have not answered my question as to whether consumers of the product will be able to fly with the O2 canisters on a commercial airline?

replies.reply_text: Hi Marc, yes we are working on that, right now it is not possible to do that, we will be able to ship it because we will follow the DOT regulations and we are working to develop a insulated container that will be make it possible to bring on a flight, we will also release more information as we go with all regulations and how far we come to solve it, have a great day

comment: Hi. Why not to make special adapter for the  cylinder to refill in regular scuba shop?
comment_html: Hi. Why not to make special adapter for the cylinder to refill in regular scuba shop?

replies.reply_text: Hi Kim, we are working on it and we will release the news here on Indiegogo as soon as it is done, thank you for reaching out to us.

comment:
Hi,

What will be the mixture of gasses we inhale?
I am really hoping you'll find a solution for us to fly with our triton on commercial flights together with the rest of the luggage.

I want to suggest adding accessories with the triton such as:
*Neck strap, so don't need to bite on mouth piece.
*HUD (heads up display) or any other way to see amount of liquid left as I have to plan my dive accordingly.
*Folding mechanism of the two cylinders? fits in a pocket / D ring to hang.
*Snorkel friendly
comment_html:
Hi,

What will be the mixture of gasses we inhale?
I am really hoping you’ll find a solution for us to fly with our triton on commercial flights together with the rest of the luggage.

I want to suggest adding accessories with the triton such as:
*Neck strap, so don’t need to bite on mouth piece.
*HUD (heads up display) or any other way to see amount of liquid left as I have to plan my dive accordingly.
*Folding mechanism of the two cylinders? fits in a pocket / D ring to hang.
*Snorkel friendly

replies.reply_text: Hi Oded, thank you for the support, so for the gases it is oxygen that you will breathe in, we going to deliver your Triton with a safety strap we are still developing it and we will release the images of it when it is done, as more accessories that makes Triton easier to handle will come with time, right now all of our focus is to finalizing Triton so we can start to deliver it in time, one of our main task to do is the solution to have the liquid oxygen on a aircraft, Have a great day

comment: Is the Triton sealed for additional depths?  E.g., spearfishing, take a breath at 15', swim lower to 30' and come back to 15'.  Will it work or implode?  Thanks.
comment_html: Is the Triton sealed for additional depths? E.g., spearfishing, take a breath at 15’, swim lower to 30’ and come back to 15’. Will it work or implode? Thanks.

replies.reply_text: Hi, Triton will not implode but still should not go deeper then 15ft due to safety reasons, have a great day and thank you for the support.

comment:
"Is the Triton sealed for additional depths? E.g., spearfishing, take a breath at 15’, swim lower to 30’ and come back to 15’. Will it work or implode?"

Let's be VERY clear about something. Breathing pure oxygen at any depth below 15', even a few deep deeper, can cause you to blackout, lose consciousness, and die. 
Using 100% oxygen canisters in this product is both dangerous and provides NO added benefit.
comment_html:
“Is the Triton sealed for additional depths? E.g., spearfishing, take a breath at 15’, swim lower to 30’ and come back to 15’. Will it work or implode?”

Using 100% oxygen canisters in this product is both dangerous and provides NO added benefit.

comment:
Hi Saeed,
If you don't have the refillable cylinder(s) by the time you ship these out and you don't get the approval or supply line needed, won't this product become useless?  Unless you supply the customer backers at least a pack of replaceable cylinders. The cost = very expensive.  A one time use product, unless the cylinders are re engineered to refill with scuba air mixture, then it would be possible to refill them in any dive shop. With this option it will be possible to go deeper then 15'.
comment_html:
Hi Saeed,
If you don’t have the refillable cylinder(s) by the time you ship these out and you don’t get the approval or supply line needed, won’t this product become useless? Unless you supply the customer backers at least a pack of replaceable cylinders. The cost = very expensive. A one time use product, unless the cylinders are re engineered to refill with scuba air mixture, then it would be possible to refill them in any dive shop. replies.reply_text: Hi Axel, we will have it done and publish a list of our distributiors and partners on how to purchase the liquid oxygen, if we can't deliver it do your destination then you have the right to get refunded from us for your Triton and you will keep your Triton if this happens, we have been preparing this for a long time and we are confident that we can deliver the canisters to our backers, the refill canisters will be available soon we are developing it and it should be done before our campaign.

comment: Since these cylinders are meant to hold liquid oxygen they will never be refillable at a dive shop. Oxygen becomes liquid at about -300f (−182c for the more civilized parts of the world). I can't even imagine how that will work or how the replacement cylinders (that need to maintain the O2 at that temperature indefinitely) will be affordable.
comment_html: Since these cylinders are meant to hold liquid oxygen they will never be refillable at a dive shop. Oxygen becomes liquid at about -300f (−182c for the more civilized parts of the world). I can’t even imagine how that will work or how the replacement cylinders (that need to maintain the O2 at that temperature indefinitely) will be affordable.

replies.reply_text: Oxygen becomes a liquid at temperatures below its boiling point of -183C and takes on a pale blue color weighing 1.14 times the weight of water. When the temperature of liquid oxygen is greater then -118.6C, the liquid will return back into a gas regardless of the pressure exerted on it. This is known as the critical temperature. 1 Liter of liquid oxygen provides 860 Liters of gas.

The liquid oxygen is kept in insulated containers (called dewars). These keep the oxygen in liquid form at a temperature of -170 degrees Celsius. The container consists of a lower portion where the oxygen is in a liquid state and a smaller upper portion where the liquid has evaporated creating a gas.
